data.quote: τὰς ἐξ ἡλίου καὶ σελήνης προϊούσας εἰς τὴν γένεσιν ποιήσεις παρατηρητικῶς φ.

children.definition: race, tribe, or class, οὔ ποτε φ. ὁμοῖον ἀθανάτων τε θεῶν χαμαὶ ἐρχομένων τʼ ἀνθρώπων Il. 5.441; γυναικῶν φῦλον Hes. Th. 1021; θεῶν ἐς φῦλον ib. 202, cf. 965, Op. 199: φῦλον ἀοιδῶν Od. 8.481: in Ep. more freq. in pl., φῦλα ἀνθρώπων, θεῶν, Il. 14.361, 15.54; φῦλα γυναικῶν, ἐπικούρων, Γιγάντων, 9.130, 17.220, Od. 7.206; ἄγρια φῦλα, μυίας Il. 19.30; φῦλα μελισσέων, of a swarm of bees, Hes. Fr. 14.5; in later Poets and Prose usu. in sg. (but pl., φ. ποικίλα θηρῶν Ar. Av. 777 (lyr.); φῦλα πόντου, of fishes, E. Fr. 27 (lyr.)), φ. ματαιότατον Pi. P. 3.21; ἓν φ. ἀνθρώπων S. Fr. 591.1 (lyr.); τὸ ἄλλο φ. the rest of the people, Id. OT 19; φῦλον ὀρνίθων the race of birds, Id. Ant. 342 (lyr.), cf. Ar. Av. 231, 253 (both lyr.): πτηνῶν ib. 1088 (lyr.); τὸ πτηνὸν φ. Pl. Sph. 220b; τὸ κηρυκικὸν φ. Id. Plt. 260d, cf. Cra. 398e; τὸ φ. . . οὐ . . ῥᾷστον συλλαβεῖν τί ποτʼ ἐστίν, ὁ σοφιστής the sophist tribe, Id. Sph. 218c; κατὰ Ὅμηρον καὶ Ἡράκλειτον καὶ πᾶν τὸ τοιοῦτον φ. and all the tribe of them, Id. Tht. 160d; φ. ἀμφορεαφόρων Eup. 187; φ. βουλευτικόν, = Lat. ordo senatorius, D.C. 59.9: metaph., φ. τῶν ἡδονῶν Luc. Nigr. 16.

data.quote: οὔ ποτε φ. ὁμοῖον ἀθανάτων τε θεῶν χαμαὶ ἐρχομένων τʼ ἀνθρώπων

children.definition: sex, τὸ γυναικεῖον φ. Ar. Th. 786 (anap.); τὸ θῆλυ, τὸ ἄρρεν, X. Lac. 1.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: nation, φῦλα Πελασγῶν Il. 2.840; κελαινὸν φ., of the Aethiopians, A. Pr. 808, cf. Supp. 544 (lyr.); βάρβαρα φ. E. IT 887 (lyr.); Σύρους, φῦλον πάμπολυ X. Cyr. 1.5.2; πολεμικώτατα φ. Plu. Sull. 29.

children.label: III
children.definition: clan or tribe, acc. to blood or descent, κρῖνʼ ἄνδρας κατὰ φῦλα, κατὰ φρήτρας Il. 2.362, cf. 363; φῦλον Ἑλένης, φῦλον Ἀρκεισίου, Od. 14.68, 181; φ. τρία τριῶν στρατευμάτων E. Supp. 653.

data.quote: κρῖνʼ ἄνδρας κατὰ φῦλα, κατὰ φρήτρας

definition: φύλοπις [ῡ], ιδος, acc. ιδα and ιν (v. infr.), ἡ,

children.definition: battle-cry, din of battle, freq. in Hom., ἔγειρε δὲ φύλοπιν αἰνήν Il. 5.496, cf. 4.65, al.; φυλόπιδα στήσειν πολέμοιο Od. 11.314, cf. Hes. Sc. 114, Il. 13.635; πόλεμος καὶ φ. 4.15, 82; νεῖκος φυλόπιδος 20.141.— Ep. word, used once by S. El. 1072 (lyr.), and in a mock oracle, Ar. Pax 1076: pl., φυλόπιδας προτέρων ὕμνησαν ἀοιδοί Theoc. 16.50.
of many races, πλῆθος νεοσύλλογον καὶ φ. D.S. 34/ 5.6.
growth, ἐπανεκλήθη ὡς ἐς φῦμα ζωῆς beginning of a fresh life, Aret. SD 2.13: but usu.,

children.label: II
children.definition: that which grows, Archil. 136; freq. of diseased growths, tumour, tubercle, etc., Hdt. 3.133, Hp. VM 22, Pl. Ti. 85c, Thphr. HP 9.11.1, Od. 59, IG 42(1).123.4 ( Epid., iv B. C.), etc.; φῦμα φύειν, φῦμα φύεται, Hp. Prorrh. 2.10, 11. [ ῡ Archil. l.c.; φῠμάτεσσι only late, Marc.Sid. 83.]
one who has tumours, φ. σκληρῶν φυμάτων Hp. Art. 41, cf. Ruf. ap. Orib. 7.26.9.

definition: φυμάτιον, τό, Dim. of φῦμα, Hp. Mul. 2.133, Ruf. ap. Orib. 7.26.15.

children.definition: have tumours, Hp. Epid. 5.59, 7.81.
full of tumours, σκέλεα [Hp.] Acut.10 [was 26].

definition: φύξ, coined as nom. to φύγαδε, EM 802.46, Eust. 1080.17.

children.definition: aversion to wedlock, prob. for φυλαξάνοραν (sic) in A. Supp. 8 (anap.).
shunning the sun, Nic. Th. 660.

definition: φύξηλις, ιος and ιδος, ὁ, ἡ,

children.definition: cowardly, φύξηλιν ἐόντα Il. 17.143, cf. Nic. Al. 472, Lyc. 943.
that have grown too large to be hurt by sheep ( μῆλα), A. Fr. 447, cf. Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.293a.

definition: φύξιμος, ον, ( φεύγω) older and poet. form of φεύξιμος, of places,

children.definition: whither one can flee, or where one can take refuge, ὅθι μοι φάτο φύξιμον εἶναι where she said it was possible for me to escape, Od. 5.359; φ. τόπος Plb. 13.6.9; φύξιμον οὐδέν Id. 9.29.4; ἱερὸν φ. an asylum, Plu. Rom. 9; φ. λιμήν a harbour of refuge, Id. Praec. 2.823a: cf. φύξιον.

children.label: II
children.definition: which one can escape; hence, affording a chance of recovery, νοῦσος Hp. Int. 2; avoidable, ἦμαρ Max. 358.
which one would flee from, i.e. loathsome, ὀδμή Simon. 250, Nic. Th. 54 (s.v.l.).

children.label: III
children.definition: σʼ ἀθανάτων φύξιμος οὐδείς is able to escape thee, S. Ant. 788 (lyr.).

definition: φύξιον, τό, f.l. for φύξιμον, place of refuge, Plu. Thes. 36.

children.definition: of banishment, οἶτος A.R. 4.699.
putting to flight, epith. of Zeus, Apollod. 1.9.1, cf. Lyc. 288, Paus. 2.21.2, Supp.Epigr. 7.894.9 ( Gerasa, i A. D.); of Apollo, Philostr. Her. 10.4, Suid.
fleeing the city, banished, Opp. H. 1.278.

definition: φύξις, εως, ἡ, older and poet. form of φεῦξις,

children.label: II
children.definition: refuge, escape, θανάτου Nic. Th. 588.
Hsch. ( φυός cod.).
Hsch.
Adv., a doubtful word (vv. ll. φύρδην, φρούδην) , τὸ φ. καὶ ῥύδην οὐκ οἶδα εἰ ἀνεκτά Poll. 6.175 (fort. φοράδην).

data.quote: τὸ φ. καὶ ῥύδην οὐκ οἶδα εἰ ἀνεκτά

children.definition: that which is mixed or kneaded, dough, Mnesim. 4.11 (anap.), Arist. Pr. 929a25, LXX Ex. 8.3 ( 7.28), 12.34, al., Ep.Gal. 5.9, Ep.Rom. 9.21, al.; in brewing, PTeb. 401.27 (i A. D.); generally, paste, κονίας καὶ βολβίτου φ. Gp. 15.2.8; καλάμου Dsc. 1.55; opp. θραῦσμα, Id. 3.84: metaph., of the human frame as a mixture, compound, Ph. 1.184, M.Ant. 7.68.
mixture, σύμμιγμα καὶ φ. ἀέρος καὶ πυρός Plu. Fac.lun. 2.922a, etc.: in pl., cements, ib. Praec. 811c.

data.quote: σύμμιγμα καὶ φ. ἀέρος καὶ πυρός

children.definition: Jahresh. 28.58 ( Aphrodisias).

definition: φύρασις, εως, Ion. φύρησις, ιος, ἡ,

children.definition: mixing, LXX Ho. 7.4, Aret. CA 2.3; ἀρωμάτων Dsc. 1.58; mixture, Gal. 6.342.
one must mix, knead, Dsc. 5.88.
mixer, i.e. ‘cooker’ of accounts, Cic. Att. 6.9.2, 7.1.9; = Lat. decoctor, fraudulent debtor, Gloss.; dub. sens. in Jahresh. 1 Beibl. 75 ( Ephesus).
kneaded, ἄρτος Sor. 2.10.

definition: φυράω, 3 pl. φυρῶσι Hdt. 2.36: fut. -άσω [ᾱ] A. Th. 48: aor. ἐφύρᾱσα Pl. Ti. 73e, Ion. -ησα Hp. Fist. 10: pf. πεφύρᾱκα Cic. Att. 6.4.3, 6.5.1:— Med., aor. ἐφυρᾱσάμην Ar. Nu. 979 (anap.); Ion. -ησάμην Nic. Th. 932:— Pass., aor. ἐφυράθην [ᾱ] Pl. Tht. 147c, APl. 16.191 (Nicaen.); Ion. -ήθην AP 7.748 ( Antip.Sid.): pf. πεφύραμαι, Ion. -ημαι (v. infr.):—

children.definition: φύρω (but almost limited to the sense of mixing flour and similar substances), φ. τὸ σταῖς τοῖσι ποσί Hdt. l.c.; οἴνῳ φυρήσας Hp. l.c., cf. PHolm. 4.9; εἰς ὕδωρ φ. ib. 6.18; φ. μετὰ ὑδραργύρου ib. 4.35; μᾶζαν φ. Hp. Vict. 2.40; οἱ φυρῶντες bread-kneaders, X. HG 7.2.22; γῆν τήνδε φυράσειν φόνῳ to make earth into a bloody paste, A. l.c.; γῆν . . ἐφύρασε καὶ ἔδευσε μυελῷ Pl. Ti. 73e: Pass., ἄρτος πολλῷ ὕδατι πεφυρημένος Hp. VM 14; ἰσχυρῶς πεφ. ibid.; οἴνῳ καὶ ἐλαίῳ ἄλφιτα πεφυραμένα (v.l. πεφυρμένα) Th. 3.49; γῆ ὑγρῷ φυραθεῖσα πηλὸς ἂν εἴη Pl. Tht. 147c.

data.quote: γῆ ὑγρῷ φυραθεῖσα πηλὸς ἂν εἴη

children.definition: μαλακὴν φυρασάμενος τὴν φωνὴν πρὸς τὸν ἐραστὴν ἐβάδιζεν making oneʼs voice supple, i.e. soft, towards oneʼs lover, Ar. l.c.; πολέεσσι πεφύρησαι χαλεποῖσι, θυμέ art confounded by . . Philet. 7.1; πεφυρακέναι τὰς ψήφους to have cooked the accounts, Cic. ll. cc.

definition: φύρδην, Dor. φύρδαν S. Fr. 210.39 (lyr.), AP 7.531 ( Antip. Thess.):— Adv.

children.definition: in utter confusion, A. Pers. 812; φ. μάχεσθαι X. Cyr. 7.1.37; σεσωρεῦσθαι Plb. 16.8.9; πάντα εἰκῇ καὶ φ. ἐπράττετο Id. 30.11.6; σύρει φ. drags headlong, S. l.c.
φύρω 1) with defilement, σίδαρον . . φ. μεστὸν ἔχουσα φόνου AP l.c.; φ. τείρων φῶτας ἐκβιάζεται Keil-Premerstein Erster Bericht p.9.
Hsch., who also has φύρκοπ· ὀχύρωμα, and φυρκηλῖται ( -είτοι cod.) · τειχήρεις.
mixture, dung, filth, Nic. Al. 485 (pl.), Th. 723.

mixture, confused mass, disorder, D.S. 18.30, M.Ant. 12.14; φ. καὶ σύγχυσις τῶν κατὰ νόμους δικαίων D.S. 36.11; ἀνθρώπων ὁμοῦ καὶ πραγμάτων Ph. Fr. 33 H.: metaph., ‘a pretty kettle of fish’, Cic. Att. 14.5.1.

data.quote: φ. καὶ σύγχυσις τῶν κατὰ νόμους δικαίων

children.definition: = sq., βοῦς PGen. 48.8 (iv A. D.); perh. cf. Hsch. s.v. φυρτίζεσθαι.

definition: φυρόχρωμος, ον, dub. sens. (of the colour of a cow), PBaden 19.5 (ii A. D.).

children.definition: mixed up, Nic. Al. 324.
mixing, kneading, ἀλεύρου καὶ ὕδατος Sch.D.T. p.215 H.

definition: φυρτήτης (leg. -ίτης) · οἶνος, Hsch. φυρτίζεσθαι· τὸ παίζειν συνεστραμμένοις φυροῖς τοῖς ἱματίοις, Id. φυρτός, ή, όν,

children.definition: mixed, kneaded up, Id.

definition: φύρω [ῡ], Hes. Op. 61, Pl. Phd. 97b: impf. ἔφῡρον Il. 24.162, A. Pr. 450: fut. φύρσω Pi. Pae. 2.73, Hsch.: aor. subj. φύρσω Od. 18.21, inf. φύρσαι A.R. 2.59; later ἔφῡρα AP 7.476 ( Mel.), Luc. Prom. 13:— Med., aor. part. φυρσάμενος Nic. Th. 507:— Pass., fut. πεφύρσομαι Pi. N. 1.68 codd.; later φῠρήσομαι ( συμ-) Sch. ad loc.: aor. ἐφύρθην A. Ag. 732 (lyr.); later aor. 2 ἐφύρην [ῠ] ( συναν-) Luc. Ep.Sat. 28: pf. πέφυρμαι (v. infr.):—

children.definition: mix something dry with something wet, mostly with a sense of mixing so as to spoil or defile, γαῖαν ὕδει φ. Hes. Op. 61; esp. of tears or blood, δάκρυσιν εἵματʼ ἔφυρον they wetted, sullied their garments with tears, Il. 24.162: c. gen. pro dat., μή σε . . στῆθος καὶ χείλεα φύρσω αἵματος Od. 18.21:— Pass., δάκρυσι πεφυρμένη 17.103, etc.; ὄμμα δακρύοις πεφυρμένοι E. Or. 1411 (lyr.); πεφυρμένος αἵματι Od. 9.397; γῆ αἵματι πεφ. X. Ages. 2.14; αἵματι δʼ οἶκος ἐφύρθη A. l.c. (lyr.); μητρὸς . . ἐν αἵμασι πεφυρμένοι E. El. 1173; πάντα βορβόρῳ πεφυρμένα Semon. 7.3; ἱστίον . . πεφυρμένον πρινὸς ἄνθεϊ stained, dyed, Simon. 54: dub. in signf. of φυράω, ἐλαίῳ ἄλφιτα πεφυρμένα, v.l. for πεφυραμένα in Th. 3.49; τέφρᾳ πεφυρμένῃ ὄξει, v.l. for πεφυραμένῃ in Gp. 5.39.2.

data.quote: μή σε . . στῆθος καὶ χείλεα φύρσω αἵματος

children.definition: κόνει φύρουσα . . κάρα E. Hec. 496; γαίᾳ πεφύρσεσθαι κόμαν to be doomed to have oneʼs hair defiled with earth, Pi. l.c.; ἄνθος ἔφυρε κόνις AP 7.476 ( Mel.).

children.label: II
children.definition: jumble together, confound, confuse, ἔφυρον εἰκῇ πάντα they mingled all things up together, did all at random, A. Pr. 450, cf. Ar. Ra. 945, Pl. Phd. 97b; ( Med., οὐκ ἂν φύροιο would not jumble your arguments, ib. 101e); φύρουσι δʼ αὐτὰ θεοὶ πάλιν τε καὶ πρόσω ταραγμὸν ἐντιθέντες E. Hec. 958; ἐν ταῖς ὁμιλίαις φύρειν to speak confusedly among themselves, M.Ant. 8.51:— Pass., to be mixed up, ἐν τῷ αὐτῷ Pl. Grg. 465c, cf. d; βίοτον ἐκ πεφυρμένου καὶ θηριώδους διεσταθμήσατο from a confused and savage state, E. Supp. 201.

data.quote: φύρουσι δʼ αὐτὰ θεοὶ πάλιν τε καὶ πρόσω ταραγμὸν ἐντιθέντες

children.definition: Med., mix with others, mingle in society, Pl. Lg. 950a; φύρεσθαι πρὸς τὸν ἄνθρωπον associate, have dealings with him, Id. Hp. Ma. 291a; φυρομένοισιν ἀεὶ περὶ γαστέρος ὁρμήν wallowing in the lusts of the belly, Opp. H. 3.440, and cf. μείγνυμι B.
confound, Pi. Pae. 2.73 (expld. by Sch. as = ἀποκτενεῖ).
Pass., metaph., to be mutually befouled by abuse, Plu. Util. 2.89d. (Prob. cogn. with πορφύρω.)

children.label: II
children.definition: aor. part. of φύω.

pair of bellows, mostly in pl., τὸν δʼ εὗρʼ . . ἑλισσόμενον περὶ φύσας, sc. Hephaestus, Il. 18.372, cf. 409; φύσας ἐσθέντες ἐφύσων Th. 4.100; αἱ φ. αἱ ἐν τοῖς χαλκείοις Arist. Resp. 474a12; τοῦ χαλκέος δύο φύσας Hdt. 1.68: hence ἐν τῇσι φύσῃς in the smithies Herod. 3.21.

data.quote: αἱ φ. αἱ ἐν τοῖς χαλκείοις

children.definition: bladder, Dsc. 5.94, Hippiatr. 33, Gloss.; φῦσαν ὑπηνέμιον AP 9.486 ( Pall.); φ. χηνεία PMag.Lond. 46.382; of the castoreum pouches of the beaver, Dsc. 2.24.
Hsch.
Id.

children.label: II
children.definition: breath, wind, blast, ἀγρίαις φύσαισι φυσᾶν S. Fr. 768; ἐς τὸν ἀσκὸν φῦσαν ἐνιέναι . . to inflate, Hp. Art. 47, cf. 77.
wind in the body, flatus, Id. VM 10, 22, Aph. 4.73; breaking of wind, opp. ἐρυγμός, πταρμός, Arist. Pr. 962a35: pl., Pl. R. 405d, Arist. HA 604a12; περὶ φυσῶν, title of work by Hippocrates.
stream, jet, φλὸξ φῦσαν ἱεῖσα πυρός h.Merc. 114.
bubble, φ. ἐπίχρυσοι Luc. Merc.Cond. 22.

children.label: III
children.definition: crater of a volcano, Str. 13. 4.11, Oros. 6.2.17.

children.label: IV
children.definition: calyx of φυσαλλίς III, Dsc. Eup. 1.51.

children.label: V
children.definition: a fish found in the Nile, Str. 17.2.4, Ath. 7.312b. (Cf. Lith. pučiù ‘I blow’, Lat. pustula, etc.; onomatop.; v. may be Egyptian.)

definition: Φυσάδεια [ᾰδ], ἡ, name of a fountain in Argos, Call. Lav. Pall. 47: hence Φῠσαδ-ειόθεν, Adv.

children.definition: from P., Antim. in PMilan. 17.12.

definition: φυσακτήρ ἄρτος ποιός τις ποπανώδης, Hsch.

children.definition: windy, full of wind, Cerc. 6.15, Nonn. D. 43.405.
bladder, bubble, Luc. Cont. 19.

children.label: II
children.definition: a wind instrument, a kind of pipe, Ar. Lys. 1245 (pl.).

children.label: III
children.definition: Dsc. 4.71, Paul.Aeg. 3.45.

children.label: IV
children.definition: bolus, pill, Aen.Gaz. Ep. 20.
toad said to puff itself up even to bursting, and to have poisonous breath, Luc. Philops. 12, Dips. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: fish which puffs itself out, prob. Tetrodon, Ael. NA 3.18.

children.label: III
children.definition: whale (cf. φυσητήρ II.2), Opp. H. 1.368, Ael. NA 9.49.
‘naturation’, Phlp. in Ph. 211.8.
Dim. of φῦσα I.2, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.26.1.
blowing, opp. ἀασμός, Arist. Pr. 964a17.

definition: φυσάω, Ion. pres. part. φυσέων Call. Iamb. 1.101 (rightly censured by Sch. in PSI 9.1094.30): ( φῦσα):

children.label: I
children.definition: blow, puff (opp. ἀάζω, Arist. Pr. 964a11), of bellows, φῦσαι . . ἐφύσων Il. 18.470; of the wind, 23.218; of men, φυσητῆρας ἐσθέντες . . φυσῶσι τοῖσι στόμασι Hdt. 4.2, cf. Th. 4.100, Call. l.c.; δεινὰ φυσᾷ snorts furiously, E. IA 381 (troch.); metaph. from a flute-player, φυσᾷ γὰρ οὐ σμικροῖσιν αὐλίσκοις S. Fr. 768; μέγα φυσᾶν, Lat. magnum spirare, E. IA 125 (anap.); οἱ φυσῶντες ἐφʼ ἑαυτοῖς μέγα Men. 302; μεγάλα φ. Id. Epit. 492, Ph. 2.85; ἡλίκον ἐφύσα τότε Luc. Nec. 12; αἷμαφυσῶν Ἄρης breathing blood and murder, S. El. 1385 (lyr.); πολιτικὸν φύσημα φ. swell with political pride, Pl. Alc. 2.145e; abs., παύου φυσῶν Ephipp. 5.20 (anap.); οὐκ ἐφύσων οἱ Λάκωνες ὡς ἀπόρθητοί ποτε; Antiph. 117 (troch.); τῇ γένῇ φυσῶντες Herod. 2.32; φυσῶσα ἐπὶ τῷ γένει D.Chr. 58.5.

data.quote: οὐκ ἐφύσων οἱ Λάκωνες ὡς ἀπόρθητοί ποτε;

children.label: II
children.definition: puff or blow up, distend, φ. κύστιν blow up a bladder, Ar. Nu. 405 (anap.); of bag-pipers, Id. Ach. 863; φ. δίκτυον, prov. of labour in vain, Phryn. PS p.121 B.; φ. τὴν γνάθον, of one going to be shaved, Ar. Th. 221 (but φ. τὰς γνάθους to puff them up, of pride, D. 19.314); distend, of disease, AP 11.13 ( Ammian.):— Pass., ἀσκοὶ πεφυσαμένοι Sophr. in PSI 11.1214d9 (cf. Epich. 246); φλέβας φυσωμένας Hdt. 4.2; ἡ γαστὴρ ἐπεφύσητό μου Ar. Pl. 699; πρόβατα ἀποδαρέντα καὶ φυσηθέντα X. An. 3.5.9; πεφυσημένοι puffy, swollen, opp. εὔχροοι, Id. Lac. 5.8.

children.label: b
children.definition: swelling, e.g. of the tongue, ὅταν φυσηθῇ Aët. 8.40; of the male breasts at puberty, φυσῶνται κατὰ ποσόν Paul.Aeg. 6.46.

puff one up, make him vain, and so cheat him, D. 13.12, 59.38; φ. αὐτὸς ἑαυτόν Aristaenet. 1.27:— Pass., to be puffed up, ἐπὶ δυνάμει X. Mem. 1.2.25, cf. D. 59.97, Arr. Epict. 2.16.10; ὑπὸ τῆς τύχης Plu. Adul. 2.68f; πεφυσημένοι τὴν ψυχήν D.Chr. 30.19.
blow up, kindle, τὸ πῦρ Pherecr. 60, Dionys.Com. 2.16; τὸν φανόν Philippid. 16: but also,
blow out, extinguish, τὴν λαμπάδα Ar. Ra. 1098 (anap.), cf. Thphr. Ign. 28 ( Pass.).
blow out, spurt or spout out, φυσῶντʼ ἄνω πρὸς ῥῖνας . . αἷμα S. Aj. 918.

blow a wind instrument, φ. κόχλους E. IT 303; also φυσᾶν abs., Ar. Av. 859, cf. Epigr. ap. Ath. 8.337f; φυσᾶντες ( Boeot.) Ar. Ach. 868; χέρʼ ἐφύση blew into . . , Theoc. 19.3:— Pass., κόχλου φυσηθέντος Id. 22.77.
Pass., to be blown about, ἀκάνθης πάππος ὣς φυσώμενος S. Fr. 868; πέτεται [ὁ πάππος] . . , ὑπὸ τῶν παιδίων φ. Eub. 107.22.

data.quote: πέτεται [ὁ πάππος] . . , ὑπὸ τῶν παιδίων φ.

definition: φυσέχη, ἡ, word coined from φύσιν ἔχειν or ὀχεῖν, as etymol. of ψυχή, by Pl. Cra. 400b.

children.definition: folles fabriles, Gloss.

that which is blown or produced by blowing, φ. ἀνεὶς δύστλητον a hard-drawn breath, E. Ph. 1438; δνοφώδη . . αἰθέρος φυσήματα, of stormy blasts, Id. Tr. 79, cf. Rh. 440; πόντιον φ. the roaring of the sea, Id. Hipp. 1211.

children.label: II
children.definition: that which is blown up, of half-formed shells, Plin. HN 9.108; δούρειον . . χῆνα τῷ φυσήματι like the Trojan horse ( δούρειος ἵππος) in inflation, i.e. stuffed, Diph. 90: state of inflation, Luc. Cont. 19.

children.label: III
children.definition: blowing, puffing, snorting, of a horse, X. Eq. 11.12: metaph., conceit, πολιτικὸν φ. φυσῶντες Pl. Alc. 2.145e; γέμοντες ὄγκου καὶ φ. Plu. Aud. 2.39d; and, in double sense, of a flute-player, μεῖζον τῆς μητρὸς ἔχων τὸ φ. Hyp. ap. Ath. 13.591f; ῥήματα . . ἀποσπῶν γηγενεῖ φυσήματι Ar. Ra. 825 (lyr.).

data.quote: μεῖζον τῆς μητρὸς ἔχων τὸ φ.

children.label: IV
children.definition: μέλανος αἵματος φυσήματα black blood blown from the nostrils, of newly slaughtered cattle, E. IA 1114.

children.label: V
children.definition: pine-resin, Gal. 13.475, Aët. 15.3.
Dim. of foreg. [φύσημα], Gloss.: metaph. of petty conceit, Arr. Epict. 2.16.10.
blowing upon or up, of coals, Thphr. HP 5.9.3.
one must blow up, τὸ πῦρ Ar. Lys. 293 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: φυσητέος, α, ον, to be blown up, inflated, ἀσκός Hp. Art. 77.
instrument for blowing, blowpipe or tube, φ. ὀστέϊνοι Hdt. 4.2, cf. Opp. H. 4.463.
bellows, LXX Jb. 32.19, Poll. 10.147, Gal. 2.717.
blow-hole or spiracle of whales, etc., Arist. HA 566b3; the funnel through which the cuttle-fish squirts its ink, ib. 541b17.

children.label: II
children.definition: one who blows a pipe or bellows, Dsc. 5.75 (v.l.), Suid. s.v. ἐξέλιπε.
whale, perh. Biscay whale, Str. 3.2.7.
wind-instrument, pipe, Ar. Lys. 1242 (pl.); gloss on φυσαλλίδες, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: = spiramentum, Gloss.

children.label: III
children.definition: furnace with bellows, opp. αὐτοματάρειον, Olymp.Alch. 91 B.
blower, ὑέλοιο Man. 1.79; bellows-blower, Dsc. 5.75.
causing flatulency, flatulent, Hp. Mul. 1.75, Arist. HA 595b6; φ. τῆς κοιλίας Id. Pr. 908b1.
blown, blown out, ὕελος φυσητή Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 5.30.32.

children.label: II
children.definition: φυσητόν, τό, fan for kindling the fire, IG 2(2).1388.77.
Adj., ἀσκοί Nonn. D. 30.70.
puffed up in mind, Hsch. (but the order of the letters requires φυσίφρων).
breathing hard, blowing, ῥέγκουσι δʼ οὐ πλατοῖσι φυσιάμασιν A. Eu. 53.
the sound made in expiration, Arist. Pr. 904a2.

blow, puff, snort, breathe hard, pant, ἵπποι φυσιόωντες Il. 4.227, 16.506; μόχθοις ἀνδροκμῆσι φυσιᾷ σπλάγχνον A. Eu. 248; φυσιῶν . . ἐκβάλλει ῥοὴν . . φοινίου σταλάγματος S. Ant. 1238: metaph., μέσφʼ ὁ δαίμων οὔρια φυσιάει Cerc. 4.49.
hiss, φυσιόωσα ἔχις Opp. C. 3.439, cf. 1.262.
to be puffed up, Naumach. ap. Stob. 4.23.7.
Ar. Ach. 525, Suid.
= Lat. plagiaula, Gloss. (dub. l.).
to be excited by eating garlic, prop. of fighting cocks, hence ὀδύναις πεφυσιγγωμένοι infuriated by vexations, of the Megarians (who were large growers of garlic), Ar. Ach. 526.
Puff-cheek, name of a frog in Batr. 56: hence φῡσιγνᾰθέω, = φυσῶ τὰς γνάθους, Tz. H. 8.tit. 201.
Theoc. Ep. 11.1.
blister on the heel caused by a burn, Poll. 4.198.

children.label: II
children.definition: stalk of garlic, Hp. Fist. 3, Thphr. HP 7.4.12; or (acc. to Sch. Ar. Ach. 525) the outer coat of a clove of garlic.
a particular kind of garlic, Diocl. Fr. 120.

definition: φυσίζοος, ον, as epith. of earth, prob.

children.definition: producing ζέα, αἶα Il. 3.243, Od. 11.301, Orac. ap. Hdt. 1.67; γῆ Il. 21.63; but reinterpreted as from ζωή ( ζόη), producing life, φυσιζόου . . γένος Ζηνός prob. in A. Supp. 584 (lyr., φυσίζοον cod.M); φ. ὕδωρ AP 9.383.12; ἀήρ Tryph. 77, etc.
producing life, Διώνυσος IGRom. 4.360.15 ( Pergam., ii A. D.) (elsewh. as f.l. for foreg.).
physical explanation, τῆς ἀστραπῆς Tz. H. 11.480.
to be or speak like a natural philosopher, Julian. ap. Gal. 18(1).255.
bread, Lacon. word in Ath. 4.139a.
a spell to open the φύσις (i.e. pudendum muliebre), PMag.Osl. 1.283.

natural, produced or caused by nature, inborn, native, once in X.,Mem. 3.9.1, not in Pl., freq. in Arist. ( τὰ περὶ γένεσιν φ. Ph. 191a3, al.), and later Prose; opp. διδακτός, X. l.c.; opp. νομικός (conventional), δίκαιον Arist. EN 1134b19; ἡ φ. χρῆσις, opp. ἡ παρὰ φύσιν, Ep.Rom. 1.26; of style, natural, simple, ἀληθὲς καὶ φ. χρῶμα D.H. Th. 42; τὸ φ., opp. τὸ τεχνικόν, ib. 34: φ. υἱός, = ὁ ἐκ πορνείας γεγονώς, opp. γνήσιος, Thom.Mag. p.362R.; υἱὸς γνήσιος καὶ φ. PLips. 28.18 (iv A. D.). Adv. -κῶς by nature, naturally, κινητόν, κινεῖσθαι, Arist. Ph. 201a24, Cael. 307b32; ὠχυρωμένη φ. λίμνῃ D.S. 20.55; ἀκατασκεύως καὶ φ. Plb. 6.4.7, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: belonging to the nature of a plant, characteristic, Thphr. HP 8.4.4, al.
belonging to growth, Stoic. 2.205, al.
φ. ὀδόντες milk-teeth, Nicom. ap. Theol.Ar. 49.

children.label: II
children.definition: of or concerning the order of external nature, natural, physical, ἡ φ. ἐπιστήμη Arist. PA 640a2; φ. φιλοσοφία ib. 653a9; ἡ φ. Id. Metaph. 1026a6, etc.; opp. μαθηματική, θεολογική, ib. 1064b2; τὰ φ. ib. 1026a4; οἱ φ. λόγοι f.l. for οἱ φυσιολόγοι, Id. EN 1154b7; φ. προτάσεις, opp. ἠθικαί, λογικαί, Id. Top. 105b21; τὸ φ., τὸ ἠθικόν, τὸ λογικόν, the three branches of philosophy, Zeno Stoic. 1.15, etc., cf. S.E. P. 2.13; τὰ πρῶτα καὶ -ώτατα the primal elements of things, Plu. Pyth. 2.395d.

ὁ φ. an inquirer into nature, natural philosopher, Arist. de An. 403a28, PA 641a21, Metaph. 1005a34; περὶ πασῶν [τῶν αἰτιῶν] εἰδέναι τοῦ φ. Id. Ph. 198a22, cf. Metaph. 1026a5: esp. of the Ionic and other pre-Socratic philosophers, Id. Ph. 184b17, 187a12, 205a5, al.: also ὁ φ., of Epicurus, Phylarch. 24J.; ὁ φυσικώτατος, of Thales, Luc. Ner. 4.

data.quote: περὶ πασῶν [τῶν αἰτιῶν] εἰδέναι τοῦ φ.

children.label: b
children.definition: surgeon, dub. in IG 1(2).950.153.
ἡ φ. ἀκρόασις, title of a treatise by Arist.; τὰ φυσικά, a name given to his physical treatises, Id. Ph. 267b21, Metaph. 1042b8; ἐπιτομὴ φυσικῶν Id. Pr. 10tit.
Adv. -κῶς according to the laws of nature, Id. Ph. 198a23; opp. λογικῶς, ib. 204b10: Comp. -ώτερον εἰπεῖν Id. GC 335b25.

children.label: III
children.definition: belonging to occult laws of nature, magical, φ. φάρμακα spells or amulets, Alex.Trall. 1.15; φυσικοῖς χρῆσθαι Gp. 2.18.8; φ. θεραπεία ib. 2.42.3; φ. δακτύλιοι Sch. Ar. Pl. 884. Adv. -κῶς Gp. 9.1.5.
able to produce, productive, σπέρμα Thphr. CP 4.4.7, al.; σῖτος ib. 4.16.3.

study the features, judge of a manʼs character thereby, τινα D. 25.98: abs., Arist. APr. 70b7; φ. ἐκ τῶν γενῶν τῶν ζῴων, κατὰ τὰ ἤθη, Id. Phgn. 805a20, b1, al.:— Pass., to be inferred from the features, ib. 806a25.
the science or art of judging a man by his features, physiognomy, Hp. Epid. 2.5 tit., Arist. Phgn. 806a19.

of or for physiognomy, Hp. Epid. 2.6 tit.; φ. σοφία S.E. P. 1.85: -κή, ἡ, Philostr. Gym. 25: -κόν, τό, name of a work by Antisthenes, Ath. 14.656f; τὰ φ., title of a treatise ascribed to Aristotle. Adv. -κῶς Eust. 838.19.
Pall. in Hp. 2.124 D.
judging of a manʼs character by his features, Arist. GA 769b20, Phgn. 805a18, 806a33, etc.

discourse on nature, investigate natural causes and phenomena, φ. περὶ πάντων Arist. Metaph. 988b27, cf. Polystr. p.12 W., D.S. 3.62, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.921d, al.: abs., ὀρθῶς φ. Phld. Rh. 2.42 S., cf. Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.118d, al., Diog.Oen. 3: c. acc., τοὺς ἰχθῦς Philostr. Gym. 44.

children.label: II
children.definition: explain from natural principles, Τιμαῖος φ. τὴν ψυχὴν κινεῖν τὸ σῶμα Arist. de An. 406b26:— Pass., Ph. 2.506.

data.quote: Τιμαῖος φ. τὴν ψυχὴν κινεῖν τὸ σῶμα

children.definition: scientific proposition, Epicur. Ep. 2p.36U.
one must theorize scientifically, Epicur. Ep. 2p.36U., S.E. P. 1.18.

inquiring into natural causes and phenomena, ἡ φ. ἡ περὶ τῶν φυτῶν Arist. Sens. 442b25; generally, Epicur. Ep. 1p.4U., 2p.35U., Metrod. Herc. 831.8, etc.; φ. καὶ θεολογία, φ. καὶ μαθηματική, D.S. 5.40, Str. 14.1.7, cf. Cic. Div. 1.41.90, Ph. 1.139, Plu. Def.orac. 2.420c, etc.; ἡ Ζήνωνος φ., title of work by Cleanthes: pl., Longin. 12.5, etc.

data.quote: ἡ φ. ἡ περὶ τῶν φυτῶν

children.definition: of or for inquiry into nature, esp. the nature of man, Gal. 19.351; φ. ἐπιστήμη Hierocl. in CA 22p.468M.; Subst., ὁ φ. Ph. 1.139.

one who inquires into natural causes and phenomena, esp. of the pre-Socratic philosophers, Arist. Metaph. 986b14, 990a3, de An. 426a20, PA 641a7, al.; φ. μᾶλλον ἢ ποιητήν, of Empedocles, Id. Po. 1447b19; ὁ φ., title of play by Sopater, Ath. 3.101a; οἱ ἀρχαῖοι φ., title of work by Chrysippus, D.L. 7.187; as Adj., παρρησία φ. cj. in Epicur. Sent.Vat. 29: Sup., ἀνὴρ -ώτατος τῶν παλαιῶν Phld. Mus. p.108K. Adv. -γως M.Ant. 10.31.
remould as by a second nature, Democr. 33.
dispose one naturally, c. inf., Simp. in Epict. p.58 D.:— Pass., πεφυσιωμένος, η, ον, having become a second nature, inveterate, Arist. Cat. 9a2.
puff up, 1 Ep.Cor. 8.1 (for Ep. part. φυσιόων v. φυσιάω):— Pass., πρὸς τὰ θέματα πεφυσιωμένος Phld. Po.Herc. 1676.9, cf. 1 Ep.Cor. 4.6; ὑπολήψεις πεφ. Phld. Mus. p.26 K.

definition: φύσις [ῠ], ἡ, gen. φύσεως, poet. φύσεος prob. (metri gr.) in E. Tr. 886, cf. Ar. V. 1282 (lyr.), 1458 (lyr.), Ion. φύσιος: dual φύσει (v.l. φύση) Pl. R. 410e, ( φύω):

children.label: I
children.definition: origin, φ. οὐδενός ἐστιν ἁπάντων θνητῶν οὐδὲ . . τελευτή Emp. 8.1 (cf. Plu. Col. 2.1112a); φ. βούλονται λέγειν γένεσιν τὴν περὶ τὰ πρῶτα Pl. Lg. 892c; ἡ φ. ἡ λεγομένη ὡς γένεσις ὁδός ἐστιν εἰς φύσιν Arist. Ph. 193b12; φ. λέγεται ἡ τῶν φυομένων γένεσις Id. Metaph. 1014b16; freq. of persons, birth, φύσει νεώτερος S. OC 1295, cf. Aj. 1301, etc.; φύσι γεγονότες εὖ Hdt. 7.134; φύσει, opp. θέσει (by adoption), D.L. 9.25; φύσει Ἀμβρακιώτης, δημοποίητος δὲ Σικυώνιος Ath. 4.183d; so ὁ κατὰ φύσιν πατήρ, υἱός, ἀδελφός, Plb. 3.9.6, 3.12.3, 11.2.2; also in acc., ἐκ πατρὸς ταὐτοῦ φύσιν S. El. 325; ἢ φίλων τις ἢ πρὸς αἵματος φύσιν ib. 1125, cf. Isoc. 3.42.

data.quote: φ. οὐδενός ἐστιν ἁπάντων θνητῶν οὐδὲ . . τελευτή
φ. βούλονται λέγειν γένεσιν τὴν περὶ τὰ πρῶτα
ἡ φ. ἡ λεγομένη ὡς γένεσις ὁδός ἐστιν εἰς φύσιν
φ. λέγεται ἡ τῶν φυομένων γένεσις

children.definition: growth, τριχῶν, παιδίου, Hp. Nat.Puer. 20, 29, cf. 27: pl., γενειάσεις καὶ φύσεις κεράτων Plot. 4.3.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: the natural form or constitution of a person or thing as the result of growth ( οἷον ἕκαστόν ἐστι τῆς γενέσεως τελεσθείσης, ταύτην φαμὲν τὴν φ. εἶναι ἑκάστου Arist. Pol. 1252b33): hence,

data.quote: οἷον ἕκαστόν ἐστι τῆς γενέσεως τελεσθείσης, ταύτην φαμὲν τὴν φ. εἶναι ἑκάστου

children.definition: nature, constitution, once in Hom., καί μοι φύσιν αὐτοῦ (sc. τοῦ φαρμάκου) ἔδειξε Od. 10.303; φ. τῆς χώρης Hdt. 2.5; τῆς Ἀττικῆς X. Vect. 1.2, cf. Oec. 16.2, D. 18.146, etc.; τῆς τριχός X. Eq. 5.5; αἵματος, ἀέρος, etc., Arist. PA 648a21, Mete. 340a36, etc.: pl., φύσεις ἐγγιγνομένας καρπῶν καὶ δένδρων Isoc. 7.74; αἱ φ. καὶ δυνάμεις τῶν πολιτειῶν Id. 12.134; ἡ τῶν ἀριθμῶν φ. Pl. R. 525c; ἡ τῶν πάντων φ. X. Mem. 1.1.11, etc.; ἡ ἰδία τοῦ πράγματος φ. IG 2(2).1099.28 (Epist.Plotinae).

data.quote: αἱ φ. καὶ δυνάμεις τῶν πολιτειῶν

children.definition: outward form, appearance, μέζονας ἢ κατʼ ἀνθρώπων φύσιν Hdt. 8.38; ἢ νόον ἤτοι φύσιν either in mind or outward form, Pi. N. 6.5; οὐ γὰρ φ. Ὠαριωνείαν ἔλαχεν Id. I. 4(3).49(67) ; μορφῆς δʼ οὐχ ὁμόστολος φ. A. Supp. 496; τὸν δὲ Λάϊον φύσιν τίνʼ εἶχε φράζε S. OT 740 (read εἷρπε, taking φ. with ἔχων), cf. Tr. 379; δρακαίνης φ. ἔχουσαν ἀγρίαν prob. in E. Ba. 1358; τὴν ἐμὴν ἰδὼν φ. Ar. V. 1071 (troch.), cf. Nu. 503; τὴν τοῦ σώματος φ. Isoc. 9.75.

data.quote: τὸν δὲ Λάϊον φύσιν τίνʼ εἶχε φράζε

children.definition: constitution, temperament, Hp. Aph. 3.2 (pl.), al.; ἡ φ. καὶ ἡ ἕξις Id. Acut. 43; φ. φύσιος καὶ ἡλικία ἡλικίης διαφέρει Id. Fract. 7; φύσιες νούσων ἰητροί Id. Epid. 6.5.1.

data.quote: φ. φύσιος καὶ ἡλικία ἡλικίης διαφέρει

children.label: b
children.definition: natural place or position of a bone or joint, ἀποπηδᾶν ἀπὸ τῆς φ., ἐς τὴν φ. ἄγεσθαι, Id. Art. 61, 62, al.; ὀστέον μένον ἐν τῇ ἑωυτοῦ φ. Id. VC 5, al.; φύσιες τῶν ἄρθρων Id. Nat.Puer. 17.

data.quote: ὀστέον μένον ἐν τῇ ἑωυτοῦ φ.

children.definition: nature, character, ἦθος ἕκαστον, ὅπῃ φ. ἐστὶν ἑκάστῳ Emp. 110.5; εὐγενὴς γὰρ ἡ φ. κἀξ εὐγενῶν . . ἡ σή S. Ph. 874; τὴν αὑτοῦ φ. λιπεῖν, δεῖξαι, ib. 902, 1310; φ. φρενός E. Med. 103 (anap.); ἡ ἀνθρωπεία φ. Th. 1.76; φ. τῆς μορφῆς καὶ τῆς ψυχῆς X. Cyr. 1.2.2; ὀνόματι μεμπτὸν τὸ νόθον, ἡ φ. δʼ ἴση E. Fr. 168; φ. φιλόσοφος, τυραννική, etc., Pl. R. 410e, 576a, etc.; δεξιοὶ φύσιν A. Pr. 489; ἀκμαῖοι φύσιν Id. Pers. 441; τὸ γὰρ ἀποστῆναι χαλεπὸν φύσεος, ἣν ἔχοι τις Ar. V. 1458 (lyr.), cf. 1282 (lyr.); Σόλων . . ἦν φιλόδημος τὴν φ. Id. Nu. 1187; ἔνιοι ὄντες ὡς ἀληθῶς τοῦ δήμου τὴν φ. οὐ δημοτικοί εἰσι X. Ath. 2.19; φύσεως ἰσχύς force of natural powers, Th. 1.138; φύσεως κακία badness of natural disposition, D. 20.140; ἀγαθοὶ . . γίγνονται διὰ τριῶν, τὰ τρία δὲ ταῦτά ἐστι φ. ἔθος λόγος Arist. Pol. 1332a40; χρῶ τῇ φύσει, i.e. give rein to your natural propensities, Ar. Nu. 1078, cf. Isoc. 7.38; τῇ φ. χρώμενος Plu. Cor. 18; θείας κοινωνοὶ φ. 2 Ep.Pet. 1.4: pl., Isoc. 4.113, v.l. in E. Andr. 956; οἱ ἄριστοι τὰς φ. Pl. R. 526c, cf. 375b, al.: prov., ἔθος, φασί, δευτέρη φ. Jul. Mis. 353a.

data.quote: ἦθος ἕκαστον, ὅπῃ φ. ἐστὶν ἑκάστῳ
εὐγενὴς γὰρ ἡ φ. κἀξ εὐγενῶν . . ἡ σή
φ. τῆς μορφῆς καὶ τῆς ψυχῆς
ὀνόματι μεμπτὸν τὸ νόθον, ἡ φ. δʼ ἴση
τὸ γὰρ ἀποστῆναι χαλεπὸν φύσεος, ἣν ἔχοι τις
ἔνιοι ὄντες ὡς ἀληθῶς τοῦ δήμου τὴν φ. οὐ δημοτικοί εἰσι
ἀγαθοὶ . . γίγνονται διὰ τριῶν, τὰ τρία δὲ ταῦτά ἐστι φ. ἔθος λόγος

children.label: b
children.definition: instinct in animals, etc., Democr. 278; οὐκ ἐπιστήμῃ οὐδὲ τέχνῃ ἀλλὰ φύσει Herm. ap. Stob. 1.41.6; ἐν τοῖς ἄλλοις ζῴοις ἡ αἴσθησις τῇ φ. ἥνωται, ἐν δὲ ἀνθρώποις τῇ νοήσει Corp.Herm. 9.1, cf. 12.1.

data.quote: οὐκ ἐπιστήμῃ οὐδὲ τέχνῃ ἀλλὰ φύσει
ἐν τοῖς ἄλλοις ζῴοις ἡ αἴσθησις τῇ φ. ἥνωται, ἐν δὲ ἀνθρώποις τῇ νοήσει

children.definition: καὶ γὰρ ἂν πέτρου φύσιν σύ γʼ ὀργάνειας, i.e. wouldʼst provoke a stone, S. OT 335; χθονὸς φ. A. Ag. 633; esp. in Pl., ἡ τοῦ πτεροῦ φ. Phdr. 251b; ἡ φ. τῶν σωμάτων Smp. 186b; ἡ φ. τῆς ἀσθενείας its natural weakness, Phd. 87e; ἡ τοῦ μυελοῦ φ. Ti. 84c; ἡ τοῦ δικαίου φ. Lg. 862d, al.; ἡ φ., with gen. understood, Smp. 191a, Phd. 109e.

children.label: III
children.definition: the regular order of nature, τύχη . . ἀβέβαιος, φ. δὲ αὐτάρκης Democr. 176; κατὰ φύσιν Pl. R. 444d, etc.; τρίχες κατὰ φύσιν πεφυκυῖαι growing naturally, Hdt. 2.38, cf. Alex. 156.7 (troch.); κατὰ φύσιν νόμος ὁ πάντων βασιλεύς Pi. Fr. 169 (cf. Pl. Grg. 488b); κατὰ φ. ποιεῖν Heraclit. 112; opp. παρὰ φύσιν, E. Ph. 395, Th. 6.17, etc.; παρὰ τὴν φ. Anaxipp. 1.18; προδότης ἐκ φύσεως a traitor by nature, Aeschin. 2.165; πρὸ τῆς φ. ἥκειν εἰς θάνατον before the natural term, Plu. Comp.Dem.Cic. 5: freq. in dat. φύσει ( ἐν φ. Hp. Aër. 14) by nature, naturally, opp. τύχῃ, τέχνῃ, Pl. Lg. 889b, cf. R. 381b; φύσει τοιοῦτος Ar. Pl. 275, cf. 279, al.; ὁ ἄνθρωπος φ. πολιτικὸν ζῷόν ἐστι Arist. Pol. 1253a3; ὁ μὴ αὑτοῦ φ. ἀλλʼ ἄλλου ἄνθρωπος ὤν, οὗτος φ. δοῦλός ἐστιν ib. 1254a15; φ. γὰρ οὐδεὶς δοῦλος ἐγενήθη ποτέ Philem. 95.2; opp. νόμῳ (by convention), Philol. 9, Archelaus ap. D.L. 2.16, Pl. Grg. 482e, cf. Prt. 337d, etc.; τὰ μὲν τῶν νόμων ὁμολογηθέντα, οὐ φύντʼ ἐστίν, τὰ δὲ τῆς φύσεως φύντα, οὐχ ὁμολογηθέντα Antipho Soph. 44 Ai 32 ( Vorsokr. 5); ἅπας ὁ τῶν ἀνθρώπων βίος φύσει καὶ νόμοις διοικεῖται D. 25.15; τοὺς τῆς φ. οὐκ ἔστι λανθάνειν νόμους Men. Mon. 492; οὐ σοφίᾳ, ἀλλὰ φύσει τινί Pl. Ap. 22c; φ. μὴ πεφυκότα τοιαῦτα φωνεῖν S. Ph. 79, cf. Pl. Phlb. 14c, etc.; φύσει πάντα πάντες ὁμοίως πεφύκαμεν καὶ βάρβαροι καὶ Ἕλληνες εἶναι Antipho Soph. 44 Bii 10 ( Vorsokr. 5); φύσιν ἔχει c. inf., it is natural, κῶς φύσιν ἔχει πολλὰς μυριάδας φονεῦσαι (sc. τὸν Ἡρακλέα); Hdt. 2.45, cf. Pl. R. 473a; οὐκ ἔχει φύσιν it is contrary to nature, ib. 489b; οὔτʼ εὔλογον οὔτʼ ἔχον ἐστὶ φύσιν D. 2.26; τὸ τόλμημα φύσιν οὐκ ἔχει Polem. Call. 36.

data.quote: κατὰ φύσιν νόμος ὁ πάντων βασιλεύς
ὁ ἄνθρωπος φ. πολιτικὸν ζῷόν ἐστι
φ. γὰρ οὐδεὶς δοῦλος ἐγενήθη ποτέ
τὰ μὲν τῶν νόμων ὁμολογηθέντα, οὐ φύντʼ ἐστίν, τὰ δὲ τῆς φύσεως φύντα, οὐχ ὁμολογηθέντα
ἅπας ὁ τῶν ἀνθρώπων βίος φύσει καὶ νόμοις διοικεῖται
τοὺς τῆς φ. οὐκ ἔστι λανθάνειν νόμους
φύσει πάντα πάντες ὁμοίως πεφύκαμεν καὶ βάρβαροι καὶ Ἕλληνες εἶναι
οὔτʼ εὔλογον οὔτʼ ἔχον ἐστὶ φύσιν

children.definition: nature as an originating power, φ. λέγεται . . ὅθεν ἡ κίνησις ἡ πρώτη ἐν ἑκάστῳ τῶν φύσει ὄντων Arist. Metaph. 1014b16; ὁ δὲ θεὸς καὶ ἡ φ. οὐδὲν μάτην ποιοῦσιν Id. Cael. 271a33; ἡ δὲ φ. οὐδὲν ἀλόγως οὐδὲ μάτην ποιεῖ ib. 291b13; ἡ μὲν τέχνη ἀρχὴ ἐν ἄλλῳ, ἡ δὲ φ. ἀρχὴ ἐν αὐτῷ Id. Metaph. 1070a8, cf. Mete. 381b5, etc.; φ. κρύπτεσθαι φιλεῖ Heraclit. 123; ἡ γοητεία τῆς φ. Plot. 4.4.44; φ. κοινή, the principle of growth in the universe, Cleanth.Stoic. 1.126; as Stoic t.t., the inner fire which causes preservation and growth in plants and animals, defined as πῦρ τεχνικὸν ὁδῷ βαδίζον εἰς γένεσιν, Stoic. 1.44, cf. 35, al., S.E. M. 9.81; Nature, personified, χάρις τῇ μακαρίᾳ Φ. Epicur. Fr. 469; Φ. καὶ Εἱμαρμένη καὶ Ἀνάγκη Phld. Piet. 12; ἡ κατωφερὴς Φ. Corp.Herm. 1.14.

data.quote: φ. λέγεται . . ὅθεν ἡ κίνησις ἡ πρώτη ἐν ἑκάστῳ τῶν φύσει ὄντων
ὁ δὲ θεὸς καὶ ἡ φ. οὐδὲν μάτην ποιοῦσιν
ἡ μὲν τέχνη ἀρχὴ ἐν ἄλλῳ, ἡ δὲ φ. ἀρχὴ ἐν αὐτῷ

children.definition: elementary substance, κινδυνεύει ὁ λέγων ταῦτα πῦρ καὶ ὕδωρ καὶ γῆν καὶ ἀέρα πρῶτα ἡγεῖσθαι τῶν πάντων εἶναι καὶ τὴν φ. ὀνομάζειν αὐτὰ ταῦτα Pl. Lg. 891c, cf. Arist. Fr. 52 (defined as τὴν πρώτην οὐσίαν . . ὑποβεβλημένην ἅπασι τοῖς γεννητοῖς καὶ φθαρτοῖς σώμασι Gal. 15.3); τῶν φύσει ὄντων τὰ στοιχεῖά φασιν εἶναι φύσιν Arist. Metaph. 1014b33: pl., Epicur. Ep. 1p.6U., al.; ἄτομοι φ. atoms, Democr. ap. Diog.Oen. 5, Epicur. Ep. 1p.7U.; ἄφθαρτοι φ. Phld. Piet. 83.

data.quote: κινδυνεύει ὁ λέγων ταῦτα πῦρ καὶ ὕδωρ καὶ γῆν καὶ ἀέρα πρῶτα ἡγεῖσθαι τῶν πάντων εἶναι καὶ τὴν φ. ὀνομάζειν αὐτὰ ταῦτα
τὴν πρώτην οὐσίαν . . ὑποβεβλημένην ἅπασι τοῖς γεννητοῖς καὶ φθαρτοῖς σώμασι
τῶν φύσει ὄντων τὰ στοιχεῖά φασιν εἶναι φύσιν

children.definition: creation, ‘Nature’, ἀθανάτου . . φύσεως κόσμον ἀγήρων E. Fr. 910 (anap.); περὶ φύσεώς τε καὶ τῶν μετεώρων ἀστρονομικὰ ἄττα διερωτᾶν Pl. Prt. 315c; περὶ φύσεως, title of works by Xenophanes, Heraclitus, Gorgias, Epicurus, etc.; [σοφία] ἣν δὴ καλοῦσι περὶ φύσεως ἱστορίαν Pl. Phd. 96a; περὶ φ. ἀφοριζόμενοι διεχώριζον ζῴων τε βίον δένδρων τε φύσιν λαχάνων τε γένη Epicr. 11.13 (anap.); so later, ἡ φ. τὸ ὑπὸ ψυχῆς τῆς πάσης ταχθέν Plot. 2.2.1; τὰ στοιχεῖα τῆς φ. Corp.Herm. 1.8; αἱ δύο φ., i.e. heaven and earth, light and darkness, etc., PMag.Leid.W. 6.42.

data.quote: περὶ φύσεώς τε καὶ τῶν μετεώρων ἀστρονομικὰ ἄττα διερωτᾶν
[σοφία] ἣν δὴ καλοῦσι περὶ φύσεως ἱστορίαν
περὶ φ. ἀφοριζόμενοι διεχώριζον ζῴων τε βίον δένδρων τε φύσιν λαχάνων τε γένη
ἡ φ. τὸ ὑπὸ ψυχῆς τῆς πάσης ταχθέν

children.definition: Pythag. name for two, Theol.Ar. 12.

children.label: V
children.definition: creature, freq. in collect. sense, θνητὴ φ. man kind, S. Fr. 590 (anap.), cf. OT 869 (lyr.); πόντου εἰναλία φ. the creatures of the sea, Id. Ant. 345 (lyr.); ὃ πᾶσα φ. διώκειν πέφυκε Pl. R. 359c, cf. Plt. 272c; ἡ τῶν θηλειῶν φ. woman- kind (opp. τὸ ἄρρεν φῦλον) X. Lac. 3.4: also in pl., S. OT 674, Pl. R. 588c, Plt. 306e, X. Oec. 13.9; in contemptuous sense, αἱ τοιαῦται φ. such creatures as these, Isoc. 4.113, cf. 20.11, Aeschin. 1.191.

children.label: b
children.definition: substances, φ. εὐώδεις καρποφοροῦσαι D.S. 2.49; ὑγράν τινα φ. καπνὸν ἀποδιδοῦσαν Corp.Herm. 1.4.

children.label: VI
children.definition: kind, sort, species, ταύτην . . ἔχειν βιοτῆς . . φύσιν S. Ph. 165 (anap.); ἐκλέγονται ἐκ τούτων χρημάτων μίαν φ. τὴν τῶν λευκῶν Pl. R. 429d; φ. [ἀλωπεκίδων] species, X. Cyn. 3.1; natural group or class of plants, Thphr. HP 6.1.1 (pl.).

data.quote: ἐκλέγονται ἐκ τούτων χρημάτων μίαν φ. τὴν τῶν λευκῶν

children.label: VII
children.definition: sex, θῆλυς φῦσα (prob. for οὖσα) κοὐκ ἀνδρὸς φύσιν S. Tr. 1062, cf. OC 445, Th. 2.45, Pl. Lg. 770d, 944d: hence,

the characteristic of sex, = αἰδοῖον, Tab.Defix. 89a6 (iv B.C.), Nic. Fr. 107, D.S. 32.10, S.E. M. 1.150, etc.: esp. of the female organ, Hp. Mul. 2.143, Ant.Lib. 41, Artem. 5.63, PMag.Osl. 1.83,324, Horap. 1.11: pl., τῶν δύοφ., of the testes, Sch. Ar. Lys. 92, cf. PMag.Par. 1.318.
natural tendency, bent, Hipparch. ap. Stob. 4.44.81 (pl.).
natural tendency, character, [νούσων] Aret. CD 1.1; φ. καὶ ζωή Porph. Abst. 1.29.
inflation, [ Gal.]14.386 (pl.): metaph., being puffed up, pride, 2 Ep.Cor. 12.20 (pl.).

the large intestine, esp. as stuffed with pudding, sausage, black-pudding, gen. φύσκης Ar. Eq. 364, Pherecr. 45; pl. φύσκαι Cratin. 164 (troch.); nom. sg. φύσκη Eub. 63.6 (anap.), Dor. φύσκα prob.a nickname, ‘pot-belly’, Sophr. 23; acc. φύσκην Philem. 60.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: blister or weal on the hand, Sch. Ar. V. 1114 (nom. φύσκα).

children.label: III
children.definition: gall-bag on a plant, Dsc. Alex. 22.
botellus (written botellius), Gloss. (s.v.l.).
Dim. of φύσκη 1, Gloss.
botellus, Gloss.
pot-belly, nickname given to Pittacus, Alc. 37B; freq. of Ptolemy VII, J. AJ 12.4.11, etc.
a throw of the dice, Poll. 7.205.
frame or stand for bellows, Suid.
like a bladder, bladder-shaped, ᾠά Sch. Nic. Al. 293.
to be swollen, f.l. in Dsc. 4.68.

definition: φύσσα, φυσσ-αλλίς, φυσσ-αλός, φυσσ-ητήρ, etc., incorrect forms for φῦσα, etc.
φυστή (sc. μᾶζα), ἡ, Att. name for

children.definition: light pastry or puff, Chionid. 7, AP 7.736 ( Leon.): in full, φ. μᾶζα Ar. V. 610 (anap.), Harmod. 1, cf. Ath. 3.114f (accented φυστῆ by Moer. p.384P.: heterocl. pl. φύστα, τά, EM 803.1).

definition: φύστις, f.l. in A. Pers. 926 (anap., leg. πάνυ ταρφύς τις, for πάνυ γὰρ φύστις).

children.definition: Growth, personified, Emp. 123.
full of wind, windy, τὸ φ. Pl. Cra. 427a: metaph., bombastic, Longin. 28.1.
flatulent, causing flatulency, Hp. Acut. 50, Arist. HA 522b32, 588a7, Sor. 2.85; φ. νοσήματα Arist. HA 605a23.
raise a plant, in Pass., EM 686.30.

definition: φυταλιά [ῡ metri gr. in Ep.], -ιᾶς, Ion. φυταλιή, -ιῆς, ἡ, ( φυτόν)

children.definition: planted place, esp. orchard or vineyard, opp. corn-land, Il. 6.195, 12.314, 20.185, IG ΙΙ(2).161 A 14 ( Delos, iii B. C.), Jul. Or. 3.125a.

children.label: II
children.definition: plant, ἡ ἰδία φ. (of Athena, i.e. olive) Call. Lav.Pall. 26; also of the vine, AP 6.44 ( Leon. (?)); φ. καλάμου ib. 7.714.

children.label: III
children.definition: planting-time, i.e. the latter part of winter, Hp. Hebd. 4, Gal. 17(1).18.
planting, φ. καρποῖο A.R. 2.1003.
Hsch.
= sq., θεοί Poll. 1.24; of Poseidon, Corn. ND 22; Ζεύς Orph. H. 15.9 [ῡ metri gr.]

definition: φυτάλμιος, ον, also α, ον Lyc. 341: ( φύω):—

children.definition: producing, nourishing, fostering, epith. of gods, as of Poseidon, Clara Rhodos 6/7.386 ( Camirus, iii/ii B. C.), Plu. Symp. 2.158e, IG 2(2).5051, 12(1).905 ( Rhodes), etc.; of Zeus, Hsch., cf. IG 12(5).13 ( Ios); of parents, φυτάλμιοι γέροντες A. Ag. 327; μητρὶ καὶ φ. πατρί S. Fr. 788; λέκτρα φ. the marriage bed, E. Rh. 920; φ. χθών Lyc. l.c.: τὸ φ. productive power, Plu. Es. carn. 1 2.994b.

children.label: II
children.definition: by birth, ἀλαῶν ὀμμάτων ἆρα καὶ ἦσθα φυτάλμιος; didst thou bring blind eyes with thee to life? S. OC 151 (lyr.). ( φυτάλμιος is said by EM 803.4. to be formed by metath. from φυτάλιμος, which is prob. coined ad hoc.)

definition: φυταρίδιον, τό, Dim. of sq., dub. in Gloss.
φυτάριον, τό, Dim. of φυτόν, Ar.Byz. Epit. 90.19, Ath. 5.210c, Sch. Ar. Av. 663, etc.

children.definition: plant, φ. νέα Plu. Def.orac. 2.411d.
planting, X. Oec. 7.20, 19.1, PSI 4.433.5 (iii B. C.), etc.: pl., X. Oec. 19.12, Thphr. HP 2.5.1.
generation, production, Pl. Thg. 121c.

children.label: II
children.definition: growth, habit of a plant, Thphr. HP 3.8.4.

children.label: III
children.definition: plantation or simply a plant, Moschio ap. Ath. 5.207d, Ev.Matt. 15.13, OGI 606.7 ( Abila, i A. D.).
panucla, Gloss.
that which is planted, plant, Pi. O. 3.18, Pl. Lg. 761b: metaph., A. Fr. 99.10, S. OC 698 (lyr.), cf. Poll. 3.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: Montpellier rocket, Reseda Phyteuma, Dsc. 4.128, Plin. HN 27.125.
fit for planting or for rearing trees, D.S. 1.36.
Arist. Mu. 399b17 (pl.), cf. Hp. Hebd. 4, PHal. 1.81 (iii B. C.), Gp. 5.6.2, al.
one must plant, Gp. 3.3.2: neut. pl. φυτευτέα Poll. 1.226.
layer, Hp. Nat.Puer. 23, X. Oec. 19.13, Thphr. HP 2.2.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: nursery or plantation, IG 12.94.33, 22.2493, D. 53.15 (all pl.).
pastinator, Gloss.
of or for planting, ἡ -κή Poll. 7.140; τὰ -κά Porph. ap. Eus. PE 3.11.
planted, πᾶν τὸ φ. Pl. R. 510a.

definition: φυτεύω, Od. 5.340, etc., Ep. inf. φυτευέμεν Hes. Op. 812; fut. εύσω X. Oec. 19.13; aor. ἐφύτευσα Il. 6.419, etc.: pf. πεφύτευκα, 3 pl. πεφύτευκαν LXX Ez. 19.13:— Med., fut. -εύσομαι Pi. P. 4.15: aor. -ευσάμην X. Mem. 1.1.8:— Pass., fut. -ευθήσομαι Gp. 5.19.1: aor. ἐφυτεύθην X. An. 5.3.12, poet. 3 pl. φύτευθεν Pi. P. 4.69: pf. πεφύτευμαι Hdt. 2.138, etc.: ( φυτόν).

children.label: I
children.definition: of the thing planted, plant trees, esp. fruit-trees, οὔτε φυτεύουσιν χερσὶν φυτὸν οὔτʼ ἀρόωσιν Od. 9.108; δένδρεα φ. 18.359, cf. Alc. 44, etc.; ἄλσος πεφυτευμένον Hdt. l.c.; συκᾶς Ar. Fr. 108 (troch.); ὄρχους, ἀμπέλους, X. Oec. 20.3, 4; joined with σπείρω, ib. 11.16, Mem. 2.1.13, Pl. Phdr. 276e; φυτείαν Ev.Matt. 15.13; ἀρώμεναι ἠδὲ φ. Hes. Op. 22; φ. ἐν γῇ X. Oec. 19.2; ἐν ἀφόρῳ ib. 20.3; εἰς γῆν Plu. Bruta anim. 2.986f; φ. ἀπὸ κορύνης Gp. 10.8.1:— Med., plant for oneself, Pi. P. 4.15, Luc. Cat. 20:— Pass., δένδρα πεφυτευμένα, opp. to those of spontaneous growth, D. 55.13.

data.quote: οὔτε φυτεύουσιν χερσὶν φυτὸν οὔτʼ ἀρόωσιν

children.definition: beget, engender, Hes. Op. 812, Sc. 29, Hdt. 4.145, Pi. N. 7.84, etc.; φυτεύων παῖδας E. Alc. 662, cf. Or. 11, Ar. V. 1133, Pl. Cri. 50d; ὁ φυτεύσας πατήρ S. OT 793, 1514, E. IA 1177 (s. v.l.); ὁ φυτεύσας alone, the father, S. Ph. 904, Tr. 1244; ὁ φ. αὐτόν E. Andr. 49, etc.: opp. ἡ τεκοῦσα, Lys. 11.4 (rarely of the mother, σὲ . . φύτευσεν Αἴθρα Ποσειδᾶνι B. 16.59); οἱ φυτεύσαντες the parents, S. OT 1007, OC 1377; τοὺς τεκόντας καὶ φυτ. Id. Fr. 64, cf. E. Supp. 1092: metaph., ὕβρις φυτεύει τύραννον S. OT 873 (lyr.); Μούσας λέγουσι Ἁρμονίαν φυτεῦσαι E. Med. 832 (lyr.):— Pass., to be begotten, spring from parents, κείνων Pi. P. 4.144; ἐκ Κρόνου Id. N. 5.7; τοῦ κακοῦ πότμου φυτευθείς S. OC 1324.

produce, bring about, cause, mostly of evils, ὅτι τοι κακὰ πολλὰ φυτεύει Od. 5.340; πρὶν ἡμῖν πῆμα φυτεῦσαι 4.668 (v.l.); φόνον καὶ κῆρα φ. 2.165, 17.82; once in Il., κακὸν μέγα πᾶσι φ. 15.134; φύτευέ οἱ θάνατον Pi. N. 4.59; φ. πῆμα S. Aj. 953; also in good sense, φ. γάμον, δόξαν, Pi. P. 9.111, I. 6(5).12; Μίνωϊ τιμάν B. 16.68; καδέων ἀνάπαυσιν Id. 18.35:— Pass., σὺν θεῷ φυτευθείς ὄλβος Pi. N. 8.17.
implant in, τοῦθʼ ἡμῖν Pl. Ti. 80e; τι εἴς τι Id. Phdr. 248d.
set up, ἄγαλμα ἐν τῷ οἴκῳ Iamb. VP 18.84.

children.label: II
children.definition: of the ground planted, plant with fruit-trees, φ. γῆν Th. 1.2; χωρίον φ. καὶ γεωργεῖν Is. 9.28: abs., Eup. 13, Philem. 116:— Med., ἀγρόν φ. X. Mem. 1.1.8:— Pass., γῆ πεφυτευμένη Hdt. 4.127, cf. X. HG 3.2.10; opp. ψιλή, Eup. 230, D. 20.115; τὰ πεφυτευμένα PHal. 1.102 (iii B.C.), etc.; γεωργία καὶ ψιλὴ καὶ πεφ. Arist. Pol. 1259a2.
take care of plants, garden, Opp. C. 1.122, Lib. Decl. 40.67.
produce plants (i.e. vines), Opp. C. 4.254.
care of vines, in pl., Opp. H. 1.309, C. 4.331, Nonn. D. 47.72.
gardener, vine-dresser, Lib. Decl. 40.72.
of plants, ὄρχοι IG 2(2).2493.27 (iv B. C.).
of or belonging to plants, τὸ φ. the vegetative principle, Arist. EN 1102b29; φ. ζωή Porph. Gaur. 3.2; περὶ φ. αἰτιῶν, title of treatise by Thphr. Adv. -κῶς, ζῆν Porph. Gaur. 1.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: φ. ζῷον, = ζωόφυτον, Arist. PA 681a33.

definition: φύτιος [ῠ], ον, also α, ον, ( φύω)

children.definition: generative, epith. of Ἥλιος, Ζεύς, Hsch.; of Leto at Phaestus, Ant.Lib. 17: hence as pr. n., Hecat. 15J.
stock, generation, race, Pi. O. 9.55, P. 9.33, Orph. A. 430, Besant. Ara 9.

children.label: II
children.definition: φύσις, AP 7.744 ( D.L.).
plant, Epigr.Gr. 1036.4 ( Nicomedia).
after the fashion of plants, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.43.

definition: φυτοεργός, όν, poet. for φυτουργός, D.P. 997, AP 9.4 ( Cyllen.).

children.definition: Gp. Prooem. 7.

plant (opp. ζῷον, Diog.Apoll. 2, Pl. Phd. 70d, R. 532b, Lg. 889c), esp. garden plant or tree, φυτῶν ὄρχατοι Il. 14.123; τὸν μὲν ἐγὼ θρέψασα φυτὸν ὣς γουνῷ ἀλωῆς 18.57, cf. Hes. Op. 571, Pi. P. 9.58 (pl.), A. Eu. 940 (lyr., pl.), E. Heracl. 281 (pl.), etc.; φυτὰ ἀκροδρύων D. 53.15; ἀμπέλων Thphr. CP 1.12.9; φ. ἔγγεια Pl. R. 546a; τὰ ἐκ γῆς φ. Id. Ti. 60a: prov., αὐτίκα καὶ φυτὰ δῆλα ἃ μέλλει κάρπιμʼ ἔσεσθαι Lib. Ep. 32.3.

data.quote: τὸν μὲν ἐγὼ θρέψασα φυτὸν ὣς γουνῷ ἀλωῆς
αὐτίκα καὶ φυτὰ δῆλα ἃ μέλλει κάρπιμʼ ἔσεσθαι

Med. 231; εἶτʼ οὐ περίεργόν ἐστιν ἄνθρωπος φ.; Alex. 141.1; κακὸν φ. πέφυκεν . . γυνή Men. Mon. 304; also in Pl., ἐμὲ καὶ σὲ καὶ τἆλλα φ. Sph. 233e; σωμάτων καὶ τῶν ἄλλων φ. Id. R. 401a.

data.quote: εἶτʼ οὐ περίεργόν ἐστιν ἄνθρωπος φ.;
ἐμὲ καὶ σὲ καὶ τἆλλα φ.

κακὸν φ. Call. in PSI 9.1092.49.
grow into a vegetative creature, opp. βρεφοῦσθαι, Theol.Ar. 6.

definition: φυτός, ή, όν, ( φύω) of a wooden statue,

gardening, APl. 16.202.

plantation, Id. 3.2.3 (pl.).
skilled in gardening: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη), = φυτουργία, gardening, Poll. 7.140. Adv. -κῶς ib. 141.

children.label: II
children.definition: begetting, generating, πατὴρ φ. A. Supp. 592 (lyr.); τοῦ φ. πατρός S. OT 1482; ὁ φ. (without πατήρ) E. Tr. 481; φυτουργὸς Θέτιδος Id. IA 949; in later Prose, πατέρα καὶ φ. Jul. Or. 2.83a.
creator, author, Pl. R. 597d.

bearing plants, γῆ Eust. 636.17.

Hsch.
